item.title: implementing basic navigation
item.description: A TextBlock <TextBlock x:Name="pageTitle" Text="Page 1" /> A HyperlinkButton <HyperlinkButton Content="Click to go to page 2" Click="HyperlinkButton_Click" HorizontalAlignment="Center"/> Code-behind: // Handle the Click event of the HyperlinkButton: private void HyperlinkButton_Click(object sender, RoutedEventArgs e) { this.Frame.Navigate(typeof(Page2)); }

item.title: navigation
item.description: Overview An app is a collection of pages. Navigation is the act of moving between pages and within a page. Navigation Structures Flat/Lateral Pages exist side by side Able to navigate from one page to another in any order Hierarchical Each child page has one parent, but a parent can have more than one child. To reach a child page, you must navigate through parent. Navigation Controls Frame Any app with multiple pages uses a Frame The app’s main page contains a Frame and a primary navigation element like a navigation view control.
